The bill will provide the nation‚Äôs tribal communities access to $8 billion in flexible funding for response efforts, plus resources for health care, education, and housing needs. Arizona tribes will see a $34 million investment through the Indian Housing Block Grant Program.

We can‚Äôt allow COVID-19 to put our election security or safety at risk. Nearly $8 million will support Arizona‚Äôs 2020 elections, which can be used to expand vote by mail and early vote options, boost online registration, add vote centers and increase safety at poll sites.

We‚Äôre getting emergency funding to local communities through the Public Health Emergency Preparedness program‚Äîthis includes laboratory testing and infection control. Arizona will receive $12.4 million for these critical public health needs.
The Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act will provide Arizona‚Äôs state and local governments with $2.82 billion to combat the COVID-19 pandemic and economic crisis.

Tomorrow, the House will pass the third coronavirus response bill‚Äîbold, bipartisan legislation that is desperately needed to protect the health and safety of all Americans and rescue our economy from collapse. Here‚Äôs how this important stimulus effort will help Arizona:

Today I asked Secretary @EsperDoD to authorize and provide additional federal funding for the National Guard so that Arizona's governor, and governors across the US, have the tools they need to keep families safe.

The @DeptofDefense decision to approve only 3,000 National Guard Members is woefully inadequate to handle the magnitude of this pandemic. Arizona faces a serious health crisis and needs the expertise and support of @AZNationalGuard to curb the effects of COVID-19.

My full statement: https://t.co/LeNPKw87JS
Lives are at stake. We must act. It's time for Arizona to step up and #FlattenTheCurve.

Third, activate the @AZNationalGuard. They are highly-trained, well-equipped experts in managing times of crisis and can provide essential logistical support for health care professionals, aid with mobile testing, and deliver protective equipment where needed.

Second, close all bars, restaurants, gyms and other higher traffic places in Arizona. It's essential to saving lives. Especially when we know not enough are being tested, waiting for more positive cases to take action will be too late. The time for action is now.

First, @AZDHS must restore transparency and share information about how many Arizonans have been tested for coronavirus. It is wrong to hide the data and it erodes public trust. In a public health crisis like this, transparency is paramount.

We are in the midst of an unprecedented public health crisis and #Arizona cannot afford to wait until it‚Äôs too late to take meaningful, life-saving action on #COVID19. We are not doing enough. There are three more things Arizona can ‚Äì and must ‚Äì do *right now*:

Dogs and cats are great companions, reduce loneliness and anxiety, and improve your overall mood and outlook. During a time when many Arizonans are going to be at home for an extended period, I urge families and individuals to consider adopting a pet. https://t.co/5oMUeBXQUQ

Arizonans deserve a coordinated, fully-funded, government-wide response to keep us safe from the coronavirus pandemic. Read more about Congress's latest efforts to put #FamiliesFirst and prevention measures you can take now:
https://t.co/0wpOGGDt64

#FamiliesFirst builds on the action we took last week with our strong, bipartisan $8.3 billion emergency funding bill. And we will continue to work on legislation that protects the health, economic security and well-being of the American people.

#FamiliesFirst also includes:
-Paid emergency leave, with up to two weeks of paid sick leave and up to three months of paid family and medical leave for workers
-Enhanced unemployment insurance
-Strengthened nutrition initiatives such as SNAP
-Increased federal funds for Medicaid

The #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act starts with making free testing available to everyone who needs it, including those who are uninsured. This is a critical step to help public health experts mitigate the spread of coronavirus.

Tonight I will vote for H.R. 6201 to respond the coronavirus outbreak, put #FamiliesFirst and protect the American people. With coronavirus reaching a pandemic level, we have a responsibility to address its severe impacts on Americans‚Äô personal safety and financial security.

We just passed H.R. 2339, the Protecting American Lungs and Reversing the Youth Tobacco Epidemic Act to:
üö≠address the new youth tobacco epidemic 
üö≠prohibit the manufacturing and sale of all flavored tobacco products
üö≠ban companies from marketing e-cigarettes to youth under 21.

The dramatic rise in the number of middle and high school students using e-cigarettes has reversed the progress made in recent decades to curb tobacco use by kids and teens. We must act now to prevent the loss of an entirely new generation to a lifetime of nicotine addiction.

It's no surprise that 97 percent of kids and teens using e-cigarettes use flavored e-cigarettes. Flavors like Rocket Popscicle, Tropical Fruit, Watermelon Wave, Electric Lemonade, Gummi Bear, and Blue Raz are being marketed to reach younger and younger audiences.

Today, more than 5.3 million young people are using e-cigarettes, including 1 in 4 high school students. That number skyrocketed by 3 million just in the last 2 years. E-cigarettes have very high levels of nicotine, putting kids at a high risk of developing nicotine addiction.

Lower Mohave County residents have been left out of federal efforts to bring justice to Downwinders. @RepGosar and I introduced a bill to ensure innocent Arizonans harmed by nuclear testing will finally get access to health care treatments and resources.

Arizonans deserve a democracy that works for all of us, not wealthy donors and special interests. I'll keep working to end the dominance of big money in politics, restore ethics in Washington, and protect and expand the right to vote. #EndCitizensUnited

I promised Arizonans I‚Äôd fight corruption in Washington so that we could get wealthy special interests out of the way and make progress on the issues that matter most. That includes lowering health care costs, raising wages, reducing gun violence, and tackling climate change.

Our first order of business in 2019 was passing #HR1, the #ForThePeople Act. It‚Äôs a set of bold reforms that will clean up corruption, expose foreign money in our politics, strengthen election security, protect voters' rights and return power back to the American people.

Citizens United gave wealthy special interests too much influence in our elections, skewed the policy debate in Washington, and made it harder for regular people to be heard. Today 76% of Americans believe government is ‚Äúrun by a few big interests looking out for themselves."

To put this spending in perspective: Super PACs‚Äîoutside groups that can accept unlimited donations from wealthy donors and corporations‚Äîhave spent almost double the cost to make all the Star Wars movies combined.

Of that $4.4 billion, nearly $1 billion dollars spent in federal elections during that time is totally untraceable, ‚Äúdark money‚Äù expenditures. Thanks to Citizens United, big donors don't have to disclose who they are or where the money comes from.

Since the Citizens United decision, 10 years ago today, American elections have been dominated by record-breaking spending by special interest groups and corporations. Over the last decade, outside groups spent more than $4.4 billion to influence our federal elections...
